from DateTime import DateTime
 from Products.ERP5Type.DateUtils import addToDate
 
 hosting_subscription = context
 portal = context.getPortalObject()
 
 if portal.ERP5Site_isSupportRequestCreationClosed():
 # Stop ticket creation
 return
 
 hs_title = hosting_subscription.getTitle()
 date_check_limit = addToDate(DateTime(), to_add={'hour': -4})
 has_newest_allocated_instance = False
 has_unallocated_instance = False
 source_instance = hosting_subscription.getPredecessorValue()
 failing_instance = None
 
 if not source_instance:
 return
 software_instance_list = [source_instance]
 predecessors_instance = source_instance.getPredecessorValueList()
 if len(predecessors_instance) > 0:
 software_instance_list.extend(predecessors_instance)
 
 # Check if at least one software Instance is Allocated
 for instance in software_instance_list:
 if instance.getAggregate("") != "":
 if (instance.getCreationDate() - date_check_limit) < 0:
 # This instance is created for more than 4 hours
 has_newest_allocated_instance = True
 else:
 has_unallocated_instance = True
 failing_instance = instance
 
 if has_unallocated_instance and has_newest_allocated_instance:
 return context.Base_generateSupportRequestForSlapOS(
 "Hosting Subscription %s is partially allocated" % hs_title,
 "%s has allocated instance(s) but, the instance %s (%s) has been unallocated for more than 4 hours." % (
 hs_title, failing_instance.getTitle(), failing_instance.getAbsoluteUrl()),
 hosting_subscription.getRelativeUrl())
 else:
 return
